job_title: Family Success Center Program Manager in Chicago, IL
pros: The work is fulfilling and the resources are available to her work done
cons: Management can seem disconnected in day to day activity.

pros: They offer tuition reimbursement of $2000 per year. take advantage of it. there are scholarships offered to the early learning center program if you are employed with them. great hours to work and understanding when family issues arise. the benefits are great as well. great insurance and they really invest in you. show up, stand out, and reap the rewards. raises every year too!!!
cons: some upper level people seem to have disconnected to the community they are trying to serve.

pros: People and the mission, most colleagues
cons: Unorganized and a lot of miscommunication, fast burn-out

pros: Easy to get a handle on things.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Chicago, IL
pros: Very flexible and allow you to learn different aspects of the job. Management is knowledgable and eager to help you learn new things. They encourage team work and welcome as well as  appreciate interns. This is a great place to learn and to discover your passions. There are plenty of opportunities to learn and grow.
cons: Salary at times can be difficult but the wealth of knowledge is worth it.

pros: Wonderfully passionate and dedicated staff. Everyone deeply cares about the mission of CPA/CPI.  As a part time employee it was a perfect growth opportunity within the sector, and I was able to participate in a lot of valuable events, projects, and ongoing programs.
cons: It is a small admin staff, so there office environment can be secluded, with most work being done independently. Not necessarily a con, but not for everyone.

pros: Great work environment, with quality supervision. All the employees that I interacted with were very approachable and willing to help you out if you needed it.
cons: From what I've heard, the pay could be stronger.

pros: Great support from supervisors, consistent and positive open lines of communication between staff members.  All employees truly care about their work and the children, and would always help any coworkers that ask for assistance.
cons: I was not with the organization long enough to notice any cons.

pros: Loved my supervisor and manager. Great co-workers. We did important but difficult work and our team really supported one another.
cons: Management doesn't listen. Eliminated our department, but refused to be honest about what was happening.

pros: Really feel like you are making a difference. The larger association does international work, as well.
cons: Head Start Director was often very busy with other meetings and organizational duties to be attentive to everyday classroom/center needs.

Agency cares about the services
Positive culture
Great time off package
cons: As a non-profit, benefit contributions aren't as large as for-profits business.
